title: 111_hr2366
content: The Cancer Drug Coverage Parity Act of 2009 is also known as the "Cancer Drug Coverage Parity Act". It aims to ensure parity in coverage for oral cancer drugs under group health plans, specifically amending the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Cancer Drug Coverage Parity Act of 2009 requires group health plans to provide equal coverage for orally administered anticancer medication as for intravenously administered cancer medications. Participants must be notified of this coverage annually. The Cancer Drug Coverage Parity Act of 2009 mandates equal coverage for oral and intravenous cancer medications under group health plans.
